theme.title: Compound time. 8th note, rest and note
theme.para: In this lesson a new rhythmic pattern is introduced, as the result of tying a group of two 16th notes and one 8th with a group of a 8th note and two 16th notes. Note that in can also be written using a quarter note:

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (time 6 8 noVisible) (n * e g+)(r e)(n * e l g-)(n * e g+)(n * e)(n * e g-)(barline) (n * e g+)(r e)(n * e l g-)(n * q.)(barline end) )))

part.title: Listen and take notice of the differences
part.para: Note the difference between the first and the second measure. Note how it is formed when tying the two groups of the first measure.

score.music: (score (vers 1.6) (instrument (musicData (clef G)(key C)(time 6 8)(n a4 e g+)(r e)(n a4 e g-)(n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(r e)(n a4 e l g-)(n a4 e g+)(n a4 e)(n a4 e g-)(barline) (n a4 e g+)(r e)(n a4 e l g-)(n a4 q.)(barline end) )))

part.para: Exercise 1 - Train your ear and practise the introduced rhythmic patterns.
